com.github.jannled.lib.math

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jannled.lib.math.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    A double matrix.
    Author:
    Jannled

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix(double[][] values)
      Not recommend because the vector is stored in a one dimensional array, so the two dimensional vector needs to be transformed.
      Matrix(double[] values, int width, int height)
      Create a matrix with the given values, they are stored as a one dimensional array, the with and height of the matrix are stored in seperate values.
      Matrix(int width, int height)
      Create an empty matrix with the given dimensions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int width,
              int height)
        Create an empty matrix with the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the matrix.
        height - The height of the matrix.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(double[] values,
              int width,
              int height)
        Create a matrix with the given values, they are stored as a one dimensional array, the with and height of the matrix are stored in seperate values.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to initialize the matrix with.
        width - The width of the matrix.
        height - The height of the matrix.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(double[][] values)
        Not recommend because the vector is stored in a one dimensional array, so the two dimensional vector needs to be transformed.
        Parameters:
        values - The values for the matrix, row major ordered.

    • Method Detail

      • identity

        public static Matrix identity(int width,
                              int height)
        Create a new identity matrix.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the identity matrix.
        height - The height of the identity matrix.
        Returns:
        The identity matrix.

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(Matrix matrix)
        Multiply the matrix with the given one.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to multiply with.
        Returns:
        The result matrix, or null if the matrix cannot be multiplied.

      • add

        public Matrix add(Matrix matrix)
        Add the matrix to the given one.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to add to
        Returns:
        The result matrix, or null if the size of the matrices is not equals

      • subtract

        public Matrix subtract(Matrix matrix)
        Subtract the matrix from the given one.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The subtrahend matrix
        Returns:
        The result matrix, or null if the size of the matrices is not equals

      • get

        public double get(int xpos,
                  int ypos)
        Get a single value from the matrix.
        Parameters:
        xpos - The X-position of the value.
        ypos - The Y-position of the value.
        Returns:
        The value stored in that position.

      • getValues

        public double[] getValues()
        Get all values in a two dimensional array. most efficient method for getting values, because the values are stored in a single-dimensional array. You might need additional informations (width and height of the matrix) to read it properly.
        Returns:
        All values in a double array.

      • getDimension

        public int[] getDimension()
        Get the dimension of the matrix
        Returns:
        The first value is the width, the second value is the height.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Getter for the width of the matrix.
        Returns:
        Number of columns.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Getter for the height of the matrix.
        Returns:
        Number of rows.

      • set

        public void set(int xpos,
                int ypos,
                double value)
        Set a value in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        xpos - The x position of the value to alter.
        ypos - The y position of the value to alter.
        value - The value to alter.

        public java.lang.String toString()
